englishTitle: The owl and the nightingale (MS Cotton) [a machine-readable transcription]

text.0: Lines 1 through 100 ICH was in one sumere dale, in one suþe di&yogh;ele hale, iherde ich holde grete tale an hule and one ni&yogh;tingale. Þat plait was stif & starc & strong, sum wile softe & lud among; an aiþer a&yogh;en oþer sval, & let þat [vue]le mod ut al. & eiþer seide of oþeres custe þat alre-worste þat hi wuste: & hure & hure of oþere[s] songe hi holde plaiding suþe stronge. Þe ni&yogh;tingale bigon þe speche, in one hurne of one breche, & sat up one vaire bo&yogh;e, - þar were abute blosme ino&yogh;e,- in ore waste þicke hegge imeind mid spire & grene segge. Ho was þe gladur uor þe rise, & song auele cunne wise: [b]et þu&yogh;te þe dreim þat he were of harpe & pipe þan he nere: bet þu&yogh;te þat he were ishote of harpe & pipe þan of þrote. [Þ]o stod on old stoc þar biside, þar þo vle song hire tide, & was mid iui al bigrowe; hit was þare hule earding-stowe. [Þ]e ni&yogh;tingale hi ise&yogh;, & hi bihold & ouerse&yogh;, & þu&yogh;te wel [vu]l of þare hule, for me hi halt lodlich & fule. "Vnwi&yogh;t," ho sede, "awei þu flo! me is þe w[u]rs þat ich þe so. Iwis for þine [vu]le lete, wel [oft ich] mine song forlete; min horte atfliþ & falt mi tonge, wonne þu art [to me] iþrunge. Me luste bet speten þane singe of þine fule &yogh;o&yogh;elinge." Þos hule abod fort hit was eve, ho ne mi&yogh;te no leng bileue, vor hire horte was so gret þat wel ne&yogh; hire fnast atschet, & warp a word þar-after longe; "Hu þincþe nu bi mine songe? We[n]st þu þat ich ne cunne singe, þe&yogh; ich ne cunne of writelinge? Ilome þu dest me grame, & seist me [boþe tone] & schame. &YOGH;if ich þe holde on mine uote, (so hit bitide þat ich mote!) & þu were vt of þine rise, þu sholdest singe an oþer w[i]se." Þe ni&yogh;tingale &yogh;af answare: "&YOGH;if ich me loki wit þe bare, & me schilde wit þe blete, ne reche ich no&yogh;t of þine þrete; &yogh;if ich me holde in mine hegge, ne recche ich neuer what þu segge. Ich wot þat þu art unmilde wiþ hom þat ne mu&yogh;e from [þ]e schilde; & þu tukest wroþe & vuele, whar þu mi&yogh;t, over smale fu&yogh;ele. Vorþi þu art loþ al fuel-kunne, & alle ho þe driueþ honne, & þe bischricheþ & bigredet, & wel narewe þe biledet; & ek forþe þe sulue mose, hire þonkes, wolde þe totose. þu art lodlich to biholde, & þu art loþ in monie volde; þi bodi is short, þi swore is smal, grettere is þin heued þan þu al; þin e&yogh;ene boþ col-blake & brode, ri&yogh;t swo ho weren ipeint mid wode; þu starest so þu wille abiten al þat þu mi[&yogh;]t mid cliure smiten: þi bile is stif & scharp & hoked, ri&yogh;t so an owel þat is croked; þar-mid þu clackes[t] oft & longe, & þat is on of þine songe. Ac þu þretest to mine fleshe, mid þine cliures woldest me meshe. þe were icundur to one frogge *     *     *     *     * snailes, mus, & fule wi&yogh;te, boþ þine cunde & þine ri&yogh;te. Þu sittest adai & fli&yogh;[s]t ani&yogh;t, þu cuþest þat þu art on vnwi&yogh;t. Þu art lodlich & unclene, bi þine neste ich hit mene, & ek bi þine fule brode, þu fedest on hom a wel ful fode. Vel wostu þat hi doþ þarinne, hi fuleþ hit up to þe chinne: ho sitteþ þar so hi bo bisne. Þarbi men segget a uorbisne: "Dahet habbe þat ilke best þat fuleþ his owe nest."
text.1: Lines 101 through 200 Þat oþer &yogh;er a faukun bredde; his nest no&yogh;t wel he ne bihedde: þarto þu stele in o dai, & leidest þaron þi fole ey. Þo hit bicom þat he ha&yogh;te, & of his eyre briddes wra&yogh;te; ho bro&yogh;te his briddes mete, bihold his nest, ise&yogh; hi ete: he ise&yogh; bi one halue his nest ifuled uthalue. Þe faucun was wroþ wit his bridde, & lude &yogh;al & sterne chidde: "Segget me, wo hauet þis ido? Ov nas neuer icunde þarto: hit was idon ov a loþ[e] [cu]ste. Segge[þ] me &yogh;if &yogh;e hit wiste." Þo quaþ þat on & quad þat oþer: "Iwis it was ure o&yogh;er broþer, þe &yogh;ond þat haue[þ] þat grete heued: wai þat hi[t] nis þarof bireued! Worp hit ut mid þe alre-[vu]rste þat his necke him to-berste!" Þe faucun ilefde his bridde, & nom þat fule brid amidde, & warp hit of þan wilde bowe, þar pie & crowe hit todrowe. Herbi men segget a bispel, þe&yogh; hit ne bo fuliche spel; al so hit is bi þan ungode þat is icumen of fule brode, & is meind wit fro monne, euer he cuþ þat he com þonne, þat he com of þan adel-eye, þe&yogh; he a fro nest[e] leie. þe&yogh; appel trendli fro[m] þon trowe, þar he & oþer mid growe, þe&yogh; he bo þar-from bicume, he cuþ wel whonene he is icume." Þos word a&yogh;af þe ni&yogh;tingale, & after þare longe tale he song so lude & so scharpe, ri&yogh;t so me grulde schille harpe. Þos hule luste þiderward, & hold hire e&yogh;e noþerwa[r]d, & sat tosvolle & ibolwe, also ho hadde one frogge isuol&yogh;e: for ho wel wiste & was iwar þat ho song hire a-bisemar. & noþeles ho &yogh;a[f] andsuare, "Whi neltu flon into þe bare, & sewi [w]are unker bo of bri&yogh;ter howe, of uairur blo?" "No, þu hauest wel scharpe clawe, ne kepich no&yogh;t þat þu me clawe. þu hauest cliuers suþe stronge, þu tuengst þar-mid so doþ a tonge. Þu þo&yogh;test, so doþ þine ilike, mid faire worde me biswike. Ich nolde don þat þu me raddest, ich wiste wel þat þu me misraddest. Schamie þe for þin unrede! Vnwro&yogh;en is þi svikelhede! Schild þine svikeldom vram þe li&yogh;te, & hud þat wo&yogh;e amon[g] þe ri&yogh;te. Þane þu wilt þin unri&yogh;t spene, loke þat hit ne bo isene: vor svikedom haue[þ] schome & hete, &yogh;if hit is ope & under&yogh;ete. Ne speddestu no&yogh;t mid þine unwrenche, for ich am war & can wel blenche. Ne helpþ no&yogh;t þat þu bo to [þ]riste: ich wolde vi&yogh;te bet mid liste þan þu mid al þine strengþe. Ich habbe, on brede & eck on lengþe, castel god on mine rise: "Wel fi&yogh;t þat wel fli&yogh;t," seiþ þe wise. Ac lete we awei þos cheste, vor suiche wordes boþ unw[re]ste; & fo we on mid ri&yogh;te dome, mid faire worde & mid ysome. Þe&yogh; we ne bo at one acorde, we m[a]&yogh;e bet mid fayre worde, witute cheste, & bute fi&yogh;te, plaidi mid fo&yogh;e & mid ri&yogh;te: & mai hure eiþer wat h[e] wile mid ri&yogh;te segge & mid sckile." Þo quaþ þe hule "[W]u schal us seme, þat kunne & wille ri&yogh;t us deme?" "Ich wot wel" quaþ þe ni&yogh;tingale, "Ne þaref þarof bo no tale. Maister Nichole of Guldeforde, he is wis an war of worde: he is of dome suþe gleu, & him is loþ eurich unþeu. He wot insi&yogh;t in eche songe, wo singet wel, wo singet wronge: & he can schede vrom þe ri&yogh;te þat wo&yogh;e, þat þuster from þe li&yogh;te." Þo hule one wile hi biþo&yogh;te, & after þan þis word upbro&yogh;te:
text.2: Lines 201 through 300 "Ich granti wel þat he us deme, vor þe&yogh; he were wile breme, & lof him were ni&yogh;tingale, & oþer wi&yogh;te gente & smale, ich wot he is nu suþe acoled. Nis he vor þe no&yogh;t afoled, þat he, for þine olde luue, me adun legge & þe buue: ne schaltu neure so him queme, þat he for þe fals dom deme. He is him ripe & fast-rede, ne lust him nu to none unrede: nu him ne lust na more pleie, he wile gon a ri&yogh;te weie." Þe ni&yogh;tingale was al &yogh;are, ho hadde ilorned wel aiware: "Hule," ho sede, "seie me soþ, wi dostu þat unwi&yogh;tis doþ? þu singist ani&yogh;t & no&yogh;t adai, & al þi song is wailawai. Þu mi&yogh;t mid þine songe afere alle þat ihereþ þine ibere: þu sch[ri]chest & &yogh;ollest to þine fere, þat hit is grislich to ihere: hit þinche[þ] boþe wise & snepe no&yogh;t þat þu singe, ac þat þu wepe. Þu fli&yogh;st ani&yogh;t & no&yogh;t adai: þarof ich w[u]ndri & wel mai. vor eurich þing þat schuniet ri&yogh;t, hit luueþ þuster & hatiet li&yogh;t: & eurich þing þat is lof misdede, hit luueþ þuster to his dede. A wis word, þe&yogh; hit bo unclene, is fele manne a-muþe imene, for Alured King hit seide & wrot: "He schunet þat hine [vu]l wot." Ich wene þat þu dost also, vor þu fli&yogh;st ni&yogh;tes euer mo. An oþer þing me is a-wene, þu hauest ani&yogh;t wel bri&yogh;te sene; bi daie þu art stare-blind, þat þu ne sichst ne bov ne strind. Adai þu art blind oþer bisne, þarbi men segget a uorbisne: "Ri&yogh;t so hit farþ bi þan ungode þat no&yogh;t ne suþ to none gode, & is so ful of vuele wrenche þat him ne mai no man atprenche, & can wel þane þu[str]e wai, & þane bri&yogh;te lat awai." So doþ þat boþ of þine cunde, of li&yogh;te nabbeþ hi none imunde." Þos hule luste suþe longe, & was oftoned suþe stronge: ho quaþ "Þu [h]attest ni&yogh;tingale, þu mi&yogh;test bet hoten galegale, vor þu hauest to monie tale. Lat þine tunge habbe spale! Þu wenest þat þes dai bo þin o&yogh;e: lat me nu habbe mine þro&yogh;e: bo nu stille & lat me speke, ich wille bon of þe awreke. & lust hu ich con me bitelle, mid ri&yogh;te soþe, witute spelle. Þu seist þat ich me hude adai, þarto ne segge ich nich ne nai: & lust ich telle þe wareuore, al wi hit is & wareuore. Ich habbe bile stif & stronge, & gode cliuers scharp & longe, so hit bicumeþ to hauekes cunne; hit is min hi&yogh;te, hit is mi w[u]nne, þat ich me dra&yogh;e to mine cunde, ne mai [me] no man þareuore schende : on me hit is wel isene, vor ri&yogh;te cunde ich am so kene. Vorþi ich am loþ smale fo&yogh;le þat floþ bi grunde an bi þuuele: hi me bichermet & bigredeþ, & hore flockes to [m]e ledeþ. Me is lof to habbe reste & sitte stille in mine neste: vor nere ich neuer no þe betere, [&yogh;]if ich mid chauling & mid chatere hom schende & mid fule worde, so herdes doþ oþer mid schit-worde. Ne lust me wit þe screwen chide; forþi ich wende from hom wide. Hit is a wise monne dome, & hi hit segget wel ilome, þat me ne chide wit þe gidie, ne wit þan ofne me ne &yogh;onie. At sume siþe herde [I] telle hu Alured sede on his spelle: "Loke þat þu ne bo þare þar chauling boþ & cheste &yogh;are: lat sottes chide & uorþ þu go." & ich am wis & do also. & &yogh;et Alured seide an oþer side a word þat is isprunge wide:
text.3: Lines 301 through 400 "Þat wit þe fule haueþ imene, ne cumeþ he neuer from him cleine." Wenestu þat haueck bo þe worse þo&yogh; crowe bigrede him bi þe mershe, & goþ to him mid hore chirme ri&yogh;t so hi wille wit him schirme? Þe hauec fol&yogh;eþ gode rede, & fli&yogh;t his wei & lat him grede." "&YOGH;et þu me seist of oþer þinge, & telst þat ich ne can no&yogh;t singe, ac al mi rorde is woning, & to ihire grislich þing. Þat nis no&yogh;t soþ, ich singe efne, mid fulle dreme & lude stefne. Þu wenist þat ech song bo grislich, þat þine pipinge nis ilich. Mi stefne is [bold] & no&yogh;t unorne, ho is ilich one grete horne, & þin is ilich one pipe, of one smale wode unripe. Ich singe bet þan þu dest: þu chaterest so doþ on Irish prost. Ich singe an eue a ri&yogh;te time, & soþþe won hit is bed-time, þe þridde siþe a[t] middel-ni&yogh;te: & so ich mine song adi&yogh;te wone ich iso arise vorre oþer dai-rim oþer dai-sterre. Ich do god mid mine þrote, & warni men to hore note. Ac þu singest alle longe ni&yogh;t, from eue fort hit is dai-li&yogh;t, & eure seist þin o song so longe so þe ni&yogh;t is long: & eure croweþ þi wrecche crei, þat he ne swikeþ ni&yogh;t ne dai. Mid þine pipinge þu adunest þas monnes earen þar þu wunest, & makest þine song so unw[u]rþ þa[t] me ne telþ of þar no&yogh;[t] w[u]rþ. Eurich mur&yogh;þe mai so longe ileste þat ho shal liki wel unwreste: vor harpe, & pipe, & fu&yogh;eles [song] mislikeþ, &yogh;if hit is to long. Ne bo þe song neuer so murie, þat he ne shal þinche wel unmurie &yogh;ef he ilesteþ ouer unwille: so þu mi&yogh;t þine song aspille. Vor hit is soþ, Alured hit seide, & me hit mai ine boke rede: "Eurich þing mai losen his godhede mid unmeþe & mid ouerdede." Mid este þu þe mi&yogh;t ouerquatie, & ouerfulle makeþ wlatie: an eurich mure&yogh;þe mai agon &yogh;if me hit halt eure forþ in on, bute one, þat is Godes riche, þat eure is svete & eure iliche: þe&yogh; þu nime eure o[f] þan lepe, hit is eure ful bi hepe. Wunder hit is of Godes riche, þat eure spenþ & euer is iliche. &yogh;ut þu me seist an oþer shome, þat ich a[m] on mine e&yogh;en lome, an seist, for þat ich flo bi ni&yogh;te, þat ich ne mai iso bi li&yogh;te. Þu liest! on me hit is isene þat ich habbe gode sene: vor nis non so dim þusternesse þat ich euer iso þe lasse. Þu wenest þat ich ne mi&yogh;te iso, vor ich bi daie no&yogh;t ne flo. Þe hare luteþ al dai, ac noþeles iso he mai. &YOGH;if hundes urneþ to him-ward, [h]e gengþ wel suiþe awai-ward, & hokeþ paþes sviþe narewe, & haueþ mid him his blenches &yogh;arewe, & hupþ & star[t] suþe coue, an secheþ paþes to þe groue: ne sholde he uor boþe his e&yogh;e so don, &yogh;if he þe bet nise&yogh;e. Ich mai ison so wel so on hare, þe&yogh; ich bi daie sitte an dare. Þar a&yogh;te men [boþ] in worre, an fareþ boþe ner an forre, an oueruareþ fele [þ]ode, an doþ bi ni&yogh;te gode node, ich fol&yogh;i þan a&yogh;te manne, an flo bi ni&yogh;te in hore banne." Þe ni&yogh;tingale in hire þo&yogh;te athold al þis, & longe þo&yogh;te wat ho þarafter mi&yogh;te segge: vor ho ne mi&yogh;te no&yogh;t alegge þat þe hule hadde hire ised, vor he spac boþe ri&yogh;t an red. An hire ofþu&yogh;te þat ho hadde þe speche so for uorþ iladde, an was oferd þat hire answare ne w[u]rþe no&yogh;t ari&yogh;t ifare.
text.4: Lines 401 through 500 Ac noþeles he spac boldeliche, vor he is wis þat hardeliche wiþ is uo berþ grete ilete, þat he uor are&yogh;þe hit ne forlete: vor suich worþ bold &yogh;if þu [fli&yogh;st], þat w[u]le flo &yogh;if þu [n]isvicst; &yogh;if he isiþ þat þu nart are&yogh;, he wile of [bore] w[u]rchen bare&yogh;. & forþi, þe&yogh; þe ni&yogh;tingale were aferd, ho spac bolde tale. "[H]ule" ho seide " wi dostu so? þu singest a-winter wolawo! þu singest so doþ hen a-snowe, al þat ho singeþ hit is for wowe. A-wintere þu singest wroþe & &yogh;omere, an eure þu art dumb a-sumere. Hit is for þine fule niþe þat þu ne mi&yogh;t mid us bo bliþe, vor þu forbernest wel ne&yogh; for onde wane ure blisse cumeþ to londe. þu farest so doþ þe ille, evrich blisse him is unwille: grucching & luring him boþ rade, &yogh;if he isoþ þat men boþ glade. He wolde þat he ise&yogh;e teres in evrich monnes e&yogh;e: ne ro&yogh;te he þe&yogh; flockes were imeind bi toppes & bi here. Al so þu dost on þire side: vor wanne snov liþ þicke & wide, an alle wi&yogh;tes habbeþ sor&yogh;e, þu singest from eue fort a-mor&yogh;e. Ac ich alle blisse mid me bringe: ech wi&yogh;t is glad for mine þinge, & blisseþ hit wanne ich cume, & hi&yogh;teþ a&yogh;en mine kume. Þe blostme ginneþ springe & sprede, boþe ine tro & ek on mede. Þe lilie mid hire faire wlite wolcumeþ me, þat þu hit w[i]te, bit me mid hire faire blo þat ich shulle to hire flo. Þe rose also mid hire rude, þat cumeþ ut of þe þorne wode, bit me þat ich shulle singe vor hire luue one skentinge: & ich so do þur&yogh; ni&yogh;t & dai, þe more ich singe þe more I mai, an skente hi mid mine songe, ac noþeles no&yogh;t ouerlonge; wane ich iso þat men boþ glade, ich nelle þat hi bon to sade: þan is ido vor wan ich com, ich fare a&yogh;en & do wisdom. Wane mon ho&yogh;eþ of his sheue, an falewi cumeþ on grene leue, ich fare hom & nime leue: ne recche ich no&yogh;t of winteres reue. wan ich iso þat cumeþ þat harde, ich fare hom to min erde, an habbe boþe luue & þonc þat ich her com & hider swonk. Þan min erende is ido, sholde ich bileue? nai, [w]arto? vor he nis noþer &yogh;ep ne wis, þat longe abid þar him nod nis." Þos hule luste, & leide an hord al þis mot, word after word, an after þo&yogh;te hu he mi&yogh;te ansvere uinde best mid ri&yogh;te: vor he mot hine ful wel biþenche, þat is aferd of plaites wrenche. "Þv aishest me," þe hule sede, "wi ich a-winter singe & grede. Hit is gode monne iwone, an was from þe worlde frome, þat ech god man his frond icnowe, an blisse mid hom sume þrowe in his huse at his borde, mid faire speche & faire worde. & hure & hure to Cristesmasse, þane riche & poure, more & lasse, singeþ cundut ni&yogh;t & dai, ich hom helpe what ich mai. & ek ich þenche of oþer þinge þane to pleien oþer to singe. Ich habbe herto gode ansuare anon iredi & al &yogh;are: vor sumeres-tide is al to [w]lonc, an doþ misreken monnes þonk: vor he ne recþ no&yogh;t of clennesse, al his þo&yogh;t is of golnesse: vor none dor no leng nabideþ, ac eurich upon oþer rideþ: þe sulue stottes ine þe stode boþ boþe wilde & mere-wode. & þu sulf art þar-among, for of golnesse is al þi song, an a&yogh;en þet þu w[i]lt teme, þu art wel modi & wel breme.
text.5: Lines 501 through 600 Sone so þu hau[e]st itrede, ne mi&yogh;tu leng a word iqueþe, ac pipest al so doþ a mose, mid chokeringe, mid steune hose. &yogh;et þu singst worse þon þe heisugge, [þ]at fli&YOGH;þ bi grunde among þe stubbe: wane þi lust is ago, þonne is þi song ago also. A-sumere chorles awedeþ & uorcrempeþ & uorbredeþ: hit nis for luue noþeles, ac is þe chorles wode res; vor wane he haueþ ido his dede, ifallen is al his boldhede, habbe he istunge under gore, ne last his luue no leng more. Al so hit is on þine mode: so sone so þu sittest a-brode, þu forlost al þine wise. Al so þu farest on þine rise: wane þu hauest ido þi gome, þi steune goþ anon to shome. Ac [w]ane ni&yogh;tes cumeþ longe, & b[r]ingeþ forstes starke an stronge, þanne erest hit is isene war is þe snelle, [w]ar is þe kene. At þan harde me mai auinde [w]o geþ forþ, wo liþ bihinde. Hwanne oþre slepeþ hire abute, ich one lust þar wi&þute, an wot of hire sore mode, an singe ani&yogh;t for hire gode: an mine gode song, for hire þinge, ich turne su[m]del to murni[n]ge. Of hure seorhe ich bere sume, forþan ich am hire wel welcume:

Ah þu me hauest sore igramed, þat min heorte is wel neh alamed, þat ich mai unneaþe speke: ah &yogh;et ich wule forþure reke. Þu seist þat ich am manne [lo&], an euereuch man is wið me wroð, an me mid stone & lugge þreteþ, an me tobu[r]steþ & tobeteþ, an hwanne heo hab[b]eþ me ofslahe, heo hongeþ me on heore hahe, þar ich aschewele pie an crowe fro[m] þan þe þar is isowe. Þah hit beo soþ, ich do heom god, an for heom ich [s]chadde mi blod: ich do heom god mid mine deaþe, waruore þe is wel unneaþe. For þah þu ligge dead & clinge, þi deþ nis nawt to none þinge: ich not neauer to hwan þu mi&yogh;t, for þu nart bute a wrecche wi&yogh;t. Ah þah mi lif me beo atschote, þe &yogh;et ich mai do gode note: me mai up one smale sticke me sette a-wude ine þe þicke, an swa mai mon tolli him to lutle briddes & iuo, an swa me mai mid me bi&yogh;ete wel gode brede to his mete. Ah þu neure mon to gode liues ne deaþes stal ne stode: ich not to hwan þu bre[d]ist þi brod, liues ne deaþes ne deþ hit god." Þe nihtegale ih[e]rde þis, an hupte uppon on blowe ris, an herre sat þan heo dude ear: "Hule," he seide, "beo nu wear, nulle ich wiþ þe plaidi namore, for her þe mist þi rihte lore: þu &yogh;eilpest þat þu art manne loþ, an euereuch wiht is wið þe w[ro]þ; an mid &yogh;ulinge & mid igrede þu wanst wel þat þu art unlede. Þu seist þat gromes þe ifoð, an heie on rodde þe anhoð, an þe totwichet & toschakeð, an summe of þe schawles makeð. Me þunc[þ] þat þu forleost þat game, þu &yogh;ulpest of þire o&yogh;e schame: me þunc[þ] þat þu me gest an honde, þu &yogh;ulpest of þire o&yogh;ene scho[nd]e." Þo heo hadde þeos word icwede, heo sat in ore faire stude, an þarafter hire steuene dihte, an song so schille & so brihte, þat feor & ner me hit iherde. Þaruore anan to hire cherde þrusche & þrostle & wudewale, an fuheles boþe grete & smale: forþan heom þuhte þat heo hadde þe houle ouercome, uorþan heo gradde an sungen alswa uale wise, an blisse was among þe rise. Ri&yogh;t swa me gred þe manne a schame, þat taueleþ & forleost þat gome. Þeos hule, þo heo þis iherde, "Hauestu," heo seide, "ibanned ferde ? an wultu, wreche, wið me fi&yogh;te? Nai! nai! nauestu none mi&yogh;te! Hwat gredeþ þeo þat hider come? Me þuncþ þu ledest ferde to me. &YOGH;e schule wite, ar &yogh;e fleo heonne, hwuch is þe strenþe of mine kunne: for þeo þe haueþ bile ihoked, an cliures [s]charpe & wel icroked, alle heo beoþ of mine kunrede, an walde come &yogh;if ich bede. Þe seolfe coc, þat wel can fi&yogh;te, he mot mid me holde mid ri&yogh;te, for [boþe] we habbeþ steuene bri&yogh;te, an sitteþ under weolcne bi ni&yogh;te. Schille ich an utest uppen ow grede, ich shal swo stronge ferde lede, þat ower pr[u]de schal aualle: a tort ne &yogh;iue ich for ow alle! ne schal, ar hit beo fulliche eue, a wreche feþer on ow bileaue. Ah hit was unker uoreward, þo we come hiderward, þat we þarto holde scholde, þar riht dom us &yogh;iue wolde. Wultu nu breke foreward? Ich wene dom þe þing[þ] to hard: for þu ne darst domes abide, þu wult nu, wreche, fi&yogh;te & chide. &YOGH;[u]t ich ow alle wolde rede, ar [ich] utheste uppon ow grede, þat ower fihtlac leteþ beo, an ginneþ raþe awei fleo. For, bi þe cliures þat ich bere,

Þeos hule spac wel baldeliche, for þah heo nadde swo hwatliche ifare after hire here, heo walde neoþeles &yogh;efe answere þe ni&yogh;tegale mid swucche worde. For moni man mid speres orde haueþ lutle strencþe, & mid his [s]chelde, ah neoþeles in one felde, þurh belde worde an mid ilete, deþ his iuo for arehþe swete. Þe wranne, for heo cuþe singe, þar com in þare more&yogh;en[i]nge to helpe þare ni&yogh;tegale: for þah heo hadde steuene smale, heo hadde gode þ[ro]te & schille, an fale manne song a wille. Þe wranne was wel wis iholde, vor þe&yogh; heo nere ibred a-wolde, ho was ito&yogh;en among man[k]enne, an hire wisdom brohte þenne: heo mi&yogh;te speke hwar heo walde, touore þe king þah heo scholde. "Lusteþ," heo cwaþ, "lateþ me speke. Hwat! wulle &yogh;e þis pes tobreke, an do þanne [kinge] swuch schame? &YOGH;e[t] nis he nouþer ded ne lame. Hunke schal itide harm & schonde, &yogh;ef &yogh;e doþ griþbruche on his londe. Lateþ beo, & beoþ isome, an fareþ riht to o[w]er dome, an lateþ dom þis plaid tobreke, al swo hit was erur bispeke." "Ich an wel," cwað þe ni&yogh;tegale, "ah, wranne, nawt for þire tale, ah do for mire lahfulnesse. Ich nolde þat unrihtfulnesse me at þen ende ouerkome: ich nam ofdrad of none dome. Bihote ich habbe, soþ hit is, þat Maister Nichole, þat is wis, bituxen vs deme schul[l]e, an &yogh;e[t] ich wene þat he wule. Ah, [w]ar mihte we hine finde?" Þe wranne sat in ore linde; "Hwat! nu[s]te &yogh;e," cwaþ heo, "his hom? He wuneþ at Porteshom, at one tune ine Dorsete, bi þare see in ore utlete: þar he demeþ manie ri&yogh;te dom, an diht & writ mani wisdom, an þurh his muþe & þurh his honde hit is þe betere into Scotlonde, To seche hine is lihtlich þing; he naueþ bute one woning. Þat [is] bischopen muchel schame, an alle [þ]an þat of his nome habbeþ ihert, & of his dede. Hwi nulleþ hi nimen heom to rede, þat he were mid heom ilome for teche heom of his wisdome, an &yogh;iue him rente auale stude, þat he mi&yogh;te heom ilome be mide?" "Certes," cwaþ þe hule, "þat is soð: þeos riche men wel muche misdoð, þat leteþ þane gode mon, þat of so feole þinge con, an &yogh;iueþ rente wel misliche, an of him leteþ wel lihtliche. Wið heore cunne heo beoþ mildre, au &yogh;eueþ rente litle childre: swo heore wit hi demþ adwole, þut euer abid Maistre Nichole. Ah ute we þah to him fare, for þar is unker dom al &yogh;are." "Do we" þe ni&yogh;tegale seide: "ah [w]a schal unker speche rede, an telle touore unker deme ?" "Þarof ich schal þe wel icweme," cwaþ þe houle; "for al, ende of orde, telle ich con, word after worde: an &yogh;ef þe þincþ þat ich misrempe, þu stond a&yogh;ein & do me crempe." Mid þisse worde forþ hi ferden, al bute here & bute uerde, to Portesham þat heo bicome. Ah hu heo spedde of heore dome, ne [c]an ich eu namore telle: her nis namore of þis spelle.
